This tool is designed to estimate the cost of any residential roof replacement or new construction project. Your total cost will vary with the choice of materials, ground dimensions input, roof pitch, and overall complexity of the roof in question.

Asphalt Shingle Roof Cost Asphalt shingles are the most typical type of roofing material used. On a typical home, materials for a roofing project will cost about $3,000. The cost to hire a contractor to replace a typical asphalt roof is $5,000- 8,000.

The following are figures for the average cost of roof replacement: 1  Asphalt: $700-$3,700. 2  Slate: $17,000-$84,000. 3  Wood shingles or shake: $7,000-$20,000. 4  Concrete tile: $8,000-$21,000. 5  Ceramic clay tile: $12,000-$21,000. Metal roofing is the most expensive and can cost up to $30,000-$40,000 for large roof replacements. The quality of the roofing material will also determine the cost of roof replacement. For example, asphalt shingles can cost anywhere from $50 for average quality to $150 or more for the highest quality (per square)
